form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Grassley (for himself, Mr. Ossoff, Mrs. Hyde-Smith, and Mr. Booker) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To increase the penalty for prohibited provision of a phone in a correctional facility, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lieutenant Osvaldo Albarati Stopping Prison Contraband Act.
Section 1791(b) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) and (5) as paragraphs (5) and (6), respectively;
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:
in the case of a violation of subsection (a)(1), imprisonment for not more than 2 years, or both, if the object is specified in subsection (d)(1)(F) of this section;
in paragraph (5), as so redesignated, by inserting , in the case of a violation of subsection (a)(2), before (d)(1)(F).

section.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Director of the Bureau of Prisons shall—

paragraph.text: conduct a review of the policies of the Bureau of Prisons pertaining to inmates who make, possess, obtain, or attempt to make or obtain a prohibited object, as defined in section 1791(d)(1) of title 18, United States Code; and
update those policies as needed to improve protections for incarcerated individuals and staff.
